newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stock restrained by profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stock restrained by profit-taking.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks were restrained in early Wednesday trade by profit-taking in blue chips, brokers said.
The Colombo all share index was 5.34 points up at 753.14 at the midday break on turnover of 124.6 million rupees.
"The all share is being held back by profit-taking among blue chips which have big impact on the index," said Sanjeeva Gunewardena of Ceylinco Stock Brokers.
A lack of sellers of blue chips had seen the shares rise aggressively on thin volumes, brokers said.
